message.content:
cs.RO, cs.HC, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a novel criterion for evaluating user input for human-robot interfaces for known tasks, which suggests a focus on robotics (cs.RO). The criterion is designed to be permissive to many chosen strategies, minimally engaging, and skill-sensitive, which suggests a focus on human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the use of the criterion for creating a shared control scheme for training or assistance, which suggests a focus on control systems (cs.SY) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the use of simulation to test the criterion, which suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
